procedures for informing employees and the public of accidental releases, evacuation steps, 7 chlorine SOP's, as well as requiring Hazmat trained emergency personnel and the proper response equipmentBatesville Water Utilities WTP has not had an accidental chlorine release in the past five years from our covered process that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or off site deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.BWU WTP will, through any incident investigations, hazard reviews or regulation changes continue to update safe operating procedures, employee response training and process equipment

Batesville WTP takes water in from the White River, treats and distributes to entities in Independence and Sharp Counties in Arkansas.In an effort to prevent and/or minimize effects of accidental chlorine release, Batesville Water Utilities WTP is more thoroughly communicating process hazards through employee training and by providing information on same to our community via the LEPC.
